description.narrative: By 2021, central and decentralized entities are better equipped to produce, analyse, disseminate and use compelling data appropriately, to inform, implement, monitor and evaluate inclusive social policies and programmes for children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021 Children's rights are better documented, and the Government uses these records to inform, cost and implement inclusive social policies.

participating-org.narrative: SECRETARIAT PERMANENT DES ORGANISAT NON GOUVERNEMENTALES

sector.narrative: Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, central and decentralized entities are better equipped to produce, analyse, disseminate and use compelling data appropriately, to inform, implement, monitor and evaluate inclusive social policies and programmes for children.

description.narrative: Field work was completed for Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey in CAR the first ever since 2010 giving a unique opportunity to update the situation of children and women and to inform sectorial policies. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Share of the national budget on education (disaggregated by pre-primary / primary / secondary)

target.value: 2021:Data dissemination through appropriated channels and based on user needs

actual.value: 2019:Data collection at local level not yet started

target.value: 2021:Resource mobilisation to implement policy measure to reduce child deprivations

title.narrative: Availability of gender-desegregate national data on the realization of children's rights, including data on children with disabilities

baseline.value: The last MICS was conducted in 2010

actual.value: 2019:452 /550 were surveyed. Data processing and analysis is ongoing
